episodeTitle: Break Through the Siege! The Navy vs. the Three Captains
description: Luffy, Law, and Kid join forces to defeat the Marines outside the Human Auctioning House. The three captains promise to meet again in the New World. Jean Bart is freed from slavery and joins the Heart Pirates. A mysterious Pacifista resembling Kuma appears and attacks Kid and Law with laser beams.

events.title: Three Captains vs. Marines Battle Begins
events.description: Luffy, Trafalgar Law, and Eustass Kid emerge from the Human Auctioning House to face the surrounding Marines. The three Supernova captains and their crews prepare to break through the Marine encirclement.
events.significance: First major collaboration between three members of the Worst Generation, showcasing their individual powers and establishing their rivalry while working together against a common enemy.

quotes.text: Anyone who does not have that dream in the New World is as good as dead!
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid challenges Luffy's claim to find the One Piece

events.title: Kid's Punk Gibson Debut
events.description: Eustass Kid uses his Jiki Jiki no Mi powers to attract all metal weapons from Marines and even inside the auction house, forming them into a massive metallic arm. He then uses this construct to unleash Punk Gibson, crushing multiple Marines.
events.significance: First named technique shown by Eustass Kid, demonstrating the devastating offensive potential of his magnetism Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid announces his attack while crushing Marines with his giant magnetic arm

events.title: Law's Room Ability Demonstrated
events.description: Trafalgar Law activates his signature 'Room' ability, creating a spherical domain. Within this space, he demonstrates his surgical powers by switching body parts of Marines around, incapacitating them without directly harming them.
events.significance: First clear demonstration of Law's Ope Ope no Mi abilities in the anime, establishing the unique and tactical nature of his Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law activates his Devil Fruit ability to create his surgical sphere

events.title: Jean Bart Freed from Slavery
events.description: Trafalgar Law uses his powers to free Jean Bart, a former pirate captain who had been enslaved by Saint Rosward as part of his collection. Law removes the explosive collar from Jean Bart and invites him to join the Heart Pirates.
events.significance: Jean Bart gains his freedom and becomes a member of Law's crew. This moment showcases Law's compassion and willingness to help the oppressed, establishing an important character trait.

quotes.text: As long as it means being free from the Celestial Dragons, I'll gladly accept!
quotes.speaker: Jean Bart
quotes.context: Jean Bart accepts Law's invitation to join his crew

events.title: Bepo in Combat
events.description: Bepo, the martial artist bear and navigator of the Heart Pirates, displays his fighting abilities by defeating Marines attempting to attack Law. He showcases his martial arts skills despite his timid personality.
events.significance: First significant combat display by Bepo, establishing him as a capable fighter within Law's crew despite his apologetic nature.

events.title: Robin's Nueve Fleur
events.description: Nico Robin demonstrates a new Hana Hana no Mi technique called 'Nueve Fleur' (Nine Flowers), sprouting nine arms to restrain and incapacitate Marines during the battle.
events.significance: Showcases Robin's continued development of her Devil Fruit techniques, expanding her combat repertoire with numbered flower techniques.

events.title: Killer Protects Kid
events.description: Killer, the masked first mate of the Kid Pirates, swiftly cuts down Marines attempting to attack Eustass Kid from behind, demonstrating his role as Kid's loyal right-hand man and protector.
events.significance: Establishes Killer's combat capabilities and his protective relationship with Kid, showing the trust between captain and first mate.

events.title: Three Captains Promise to Meet in the New World
events.description: After defeating the Marines, Luffy, Law, and Kid exchange words about their ambitions. Kid warns Luffy that next time they meet, no mercy will be shown. Luffy replies that he will be the one to find the One Piece and laughs. The three captains part ways, promising to meet again in the New World.
events.significance: Establishes the rivalry and mutual respect between the three Supernovas. This promise sets up future confrontations and demonstrates their shared determination to conquer the New World.

quotes.text: The next time we meet, no mercy will be shown.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid warns Luffy about their future confrontation

quotes.text: I will be the one who finds One Piece!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy responds to Kid's challenge with his usual confidence

events.title: Rosy Life Riders Arrive to Help
events.description: Duval and the Rosy Life Riders (formerly the Flying Fish Riders) arrive with their flying fish mounts to help the Straw Hat Pirates escape from Sabaody Archipelago, honoring their alliance with the crew.
events.significance: Demonstrates the value of the Straw Hats' earlier friendship with Duval, as he comes to their aid in a time of crisis. Shows how Luffy's tendency to make allies pays off.

events.title: Pacifista Appears and Attacks
events.description: A mysterious figure that looks exactly like Bartholomew Kuma appears before the Kid Pirates and Heart Pirates. The figure attacks them with powerful laser beams from its hands and mouth. Law initially mistakes it for the real Warlord Kuma, not knowing about the existence of Pacifistas.
events.significance: First appearance of a Pacifista cyborg in the anime, a major technological threat created by Dr. Vegapunk. This marks a turning point where the Supernovas realize the World Government's military might, foreshadowing the chaos to come at Sabaody.

quotes.text: I don't want to encounter an admiral here!
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law mistakes the Pacifista for Bartholomew Kuma, a Warlord

events.title: Rayleigh Reveals Roger's History
events.description: Back at Shakky's bar, Silvers Rayleigh begins revealing crucial information about Gol D. Roger to the Straw Hats. He discloses that he served as vice-captain and first mate of the Roger Pirates, and reveals that Roger turned himself in to the Marines rather than being captured, doing so because he had contracted a terminal illness four years before his execution.
events.significance: Major world-building revelation that reframes the entire history of the Pirate King. Learning that Roger turned himself in willingly and was dying anyway adds tragic depth to his execution and the beginning of the Great Pirate Age.

quotes.text: Roger turned himself in to the Marines.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh reveals the truth about Roger's capture

quotes.text: Anyone who does not have that dream in the New World is as good as dead!
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid's response to Luffy's declaration about finding One Piece

quotes.text: I will be the one who finds One Piece!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's confident declaration to Kid and Law

quotes.text: The next time we meet, no mercy will be shown.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid's warning to Luffy as they part ways

quotes.text: Roger turned himself in to the Marines.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh reveals the truth about the Pirate King's capture

themes.description: The episode showcases the complex dynamic between Luffy, Law, and Kid - they are rivals with the same ultimate goal but can work together when necessary. Their parting exchange demonstrates mutual respect despite their competitive nature.
themes.symbolism: The three captains standing together against the Marines symbolizes the new generation of pirates rising up against the established order.

themes.description: Jean Bart's freedom from slavery and his choice to join Law's crew represents the theme of liberation that runs throughout One Piece. Law's willingness to free him shows the moral distinction between pirates and the World Government.
themes.symbolism: The breaking of Jean Bart's slave collar symbolizes breaking free from oppression and the World Government's tyranny.

themes.description: Rayleigh's revelations about Roger recontextualize the entire foundation of the Great Pirate Age, adding depth and tragedy to the legendary Pirate King's story.
themes.symbolism: Roger's terminal illness and willing sacrifice represents how even legends are mortal, and how their choices echo through time.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battle sequences between the three crews and the Marines with additional combat choreography.
The anime added more visual detail to Kid's Punk Gibson attack, showing the metal weapons flying from further distances.

trivia.fact: This episode features the first appearance of a Pacifista in the anime, introducing one of the World Government's most powerful weapons before the full reveal in later episodes.
The opening theme 'Share the World' by Tohoshinki was the 11th One Piece opening and celebrated the anime's 10th anniversary.
Jean Bart's name is likely a reference to Jean Bart, a famous French naval commander and privateer from the 17th-18th century.
The episode covers manga chapters 505 and 506, both from Volume 52.
This episode has a 9.0 rating on IMDb, making it one of the highly-rated episodes of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc.
